title: ALTERNATIVE WAY of making ArcSoft's DTS Decoder to work in EAC3T
description:
A. This has been THOROUGHLY tested on x86 & 64-bit versions of XP, VISTA & W7 and found to be working flawlessly.

B. ASAudioHD.ax, as well as other included .dll files (except of course from "checkactivate.dll" which comes from a TMT 2 trial version installation) have been taken out from a TotalMedia Theatre 3, v3.0.1.161 installation.


HOW TO:

1. Copy ALL the following included files (8) to your eac3to directory (folder).
ASAudioHD.ax
checkactivate.dll (v1.0.0.4)
DtsDec.dll (v1.0.2.2)
dtsdecoderdll.dll (v1.1.0.7)
MagCore.dll (v1.0.0.180)
MagPCMac.dll (v1.0.0.180)
MagUIEngine.dll (v1.0.0.180)
MagUIInter.dll (v1.0.0.180)

2. Open a COMMAND PROMPT (cmd.exe) as administrator (right click on it and select "Run as administrator" from the drop down menu) to register ASAudioHD.ax. Look for Command Prompt in: Start menu -> All Programs -> Accessories -> Command Prompt. An exapmle of the exact text to be typed in/copied, could be the following (end quotes should be also included). Just make sure you'll put YOUR OWN correct path (to eac3to directory).

			regsvr32 "C:EAC3TOeac3to v3.17ASAudioHD.ax"

That's all. No pc restar is required. Now you can use ArcoSoft's DTS Decoder in "eac3to"!
